body_html:
Hi,
To sum up:

  • Installing and using pytorch from conda always worked. My segfault problem happens only when importing both torch and fasttext in python.
  • Installing pytorch from sources fails. I'm currently investigating the problem that you mentioned with eigen and pybind11. I tried to install eigen and pybind11 (conda install -c omnia eigen3, conda install -c conda-forge pybind11) before compiling pytorch with python setup install, but the log still says:
CMake Warning at cmake/Dependencies.cmake:330 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindEigen3.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
  asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "Eigen3", but
  CMake did not find one.

  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "Eigen3" with any
  of the following names:

    Eigen3Config.cmake
    eigen3-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "Eigen3" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
  "Eigen3_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If "Eigen3"
  provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has been
  installed.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:187 (include)


-- Did not find system Eigen. Using third party subdirectory.
-- Could NOT find pybind11 (missing: pybind11_INCLUDE_DIR)

pybind11 is mentioned both in the compilation error from sources AND in the segfault log after installing from conda, so I suspect the problems are related.
I'm still trying...
body_text:

To sum up:

Installing and using pytorch from conda always worked. My segfault problem happens only when importing both torch and fasttext in python.
Installing pytorch from sources fails. I'm currently investigating the problem that you mentioned with eigen and pybind11. I tried to install eigen and pybind11 (conda install -c omnia eigen3, conda install -c conda-forge pybind11) before compiling pytorch with python setup install, but the log still says:

CMake Warning at cmake/Dependencies.cmake:330 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindEigen3.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has

pybind11 is mentioned both in the compilation error from sources AND in the segfault log after installing from conda, so I suspect the problems are related.
I'm still trying...
body:
Hi,
To sum up:
- Installing and using pytorch from conda always worked. My segfault problem happens only when importing both torch and fasttext in python.
- Installing pytorch from sources fails. I'm currently investigating the problem that you mentioned with eigen and pybind11. I tried to install eigen and pybind11 (`conda install -c omnia eigen3`, `conda install -c conda-forge pybind11`) before compiling pytorch with `python setup install`, but the log still says:

```
CMake Warning at cmake/Dependencies.cmake:330 (find_package):
  By not providing "FindEigen3.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
  asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "Eigen3", but
  CMake did not find one.

  Could not find a package configuration file provided by "Eigen3" with any
  of the following names:

    Eigen3Config.cmake
    eigen3-config.cmake

  Add the installation prefix of "Eigen3" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
  "Eigen3_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If "Eigen3"
  provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has been
  installed.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:187 (include)


-- Did not find system Eigen. Using third party subdirectory.
-- Could NOT find pybind11 (missing: pybind11_INCLUDE_DIR) 
```

pybind11 is mentioned both in the compilation error from sources AND in the segfault log after installing from conda, so I suspect the problems are related. 
I'm still trying...
